intro: Commelina auriculata f. diltopurpurea, commonly known as the purple-leaf commelina, is a variant of the commelina plant characterized by its striking purple foliage. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a vibrant purple hue, contrasting with its smaller, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking colorful, low-maintenance plants.
